alert.note: Alert for Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 8:43PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Lucie, east central Okeechobee and south central Indian River Counties through 915 PM EST... At 842 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Four Seasons Estates, or 7 miles northeast of Okeechobee, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Pierce, Okeechobee, Fort Pierce South, Whispering Pines, and Country Hills Estates. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
